perturbation.original_text: All subscription funds received by Capital Resources (and if by check shall be made payable to the Company) or by other NASD registered broker-dealers soliciting subscriptions (if any) shall be transmitted (either by U.S. Mail or similar type of transmittal) to the Company by noon of the following business day.
perturbation.changed_text: All subscription funds received by Capital Resources (and if by check shall be made payable to the Company) or by other NASD registered broker-dealers soliciting subscriptions (if any) shall be transmitted (either by U.S. Mail or similar type of transmittal) to the Company within five business days.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the timeframe for transmitting subscription funds to five business days. This contradicts SEC Rule 15c2-4, which requires prompt transmission of funds, typically interpreted as the next business day.

perturbation.original_text: The Company will make generally available to its security holders as soon as practicable, but not later than 90 days after the close of the period an earnings statement (in form complying with the provisions of Rule 158 under the 1933 Act) covering a twelve-month period beginning not later than the first day of the Company's fiscal quarter next following the effective date (as defined in said Rule 158) of the Registration Statement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will make generally available to its security holders as soon as practicable, but no earnings statement is required.
perturbation.explanation: This removes the requirement for the company to provide earnings statements. This contradicts the requirements for publicly traded companies to periodically report on the operations and financial standing of the entity.

perturbation.original_text: During the period during which the Company's common stock is registered under the 1934 Act or for three years from the date hereof, whichever period is greater, the Company will furnish to its stockholders as soon as practicable after the end of each fiscal year an annual report (including a balance sheet and statements of income, stockholders' equity and changes in financial position or cash flow statement of the Company as at the end of and for such year, certified by independent public accountants and prepared in accordance with Regulation S-X under the 1934 Act).
perturbation.changed_text: During the period during which the Company's common stock is registered under the 1934 Act or for one year from the date hereof, whichever period is greater, the Company will furnish to its stockholders as soon as reasonably convenient after the end of each fiscal year an annual report (containing the Company's balance sheet and statements of income).
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the company will send out reports for the registration period, or for three years. The modified text mandates that the company will send out reports for the registration period, or for one year. This change of duration creates non-compliance with regulatory standards, as some laws and regulations for annual reports require 3 years. Additionally, the removal of 'certified by independent public accountants and prepared in accordance with Regulation S-X under the 1934 Act' further weakens required reporting standards.
